commit.message:
Correct format() in source-serif-variable.css

This is required to let browsers that don’t support variable
fonts (e.g. Firefox on Windows 8) avoid downloading them and fall back
to something usable.

Signed-off-by: Anders Kaseorg <andersk@mit.edu>

Updated styles.css - normal font is 400

I thought the 'Regular' weight looked too heavy in the demo until I checked that its set to `font-weight: 500`. Setting it to `400` looks correct.
Update readme to include link to SS4 blog post

Update font files to version 4.004

- add 48 new styles via optical sizes
- create small demo page to test the provided CSS files
- update package.json

Update README.md

Add “Font installation instructions” and “Design information” sections.
Those used to be in the README.md of the main branch, but make more sense here.

Update README.md

Update paths in json file
Update year in LICENSE.md
Add font-display: swap to bold style

commit.message:
Fix the STAT table of the variable fonts

These fonts were built with
* afdko v2.9.9a12
* fontmake v1.10.1

Fixes spacing and displaying issues in many TrueType composite glyphs

Fixes #44

Update package.json

Additional steps to update the package on npmjs.com:
1. Update/install npm: 'npm install -g npm@latest'
2. Login: 'npm login'
3. cd to folder containing package.json
4. Publish new version: 'npm publish'
Add missing @font-face calls for italic styles
